definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
Advent (Christian period of 4 weeks before Christmas)
Whit Sunday (Christian Festival celebrating the Holy Spirit)
Advent (Christian period of 4 weeks before Christmas)

sentences.english: Opportunit ies come to you due to the favorable influence of your parents.
sentences.chinese: 机会的降临源于你受到父母的良好影响。

sentences.english: In primitive tribes, dreams were thought to be the indication of God or the haunting of the devil.
sentences.chinese: 在原始部落中，梦被当成天神降临或是妖魔附体。

sentences.english: As we worship Him with these songs, we shall be greatly blessed!
sentences.chinese: 当我们唱诗投入敬拜时，神的福气亦会随着降临。

sentences.english: Respectfully requests, and praying fathers come to enjoy the family size peace, prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 恭请祖宗降临享用，并祈保合家大小平安，兴旺发达。

sentences.english: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass.
sentences.chinese: 祂必降临，像雨降在已割的草地上。

sentences.english: I will join in the assault upon Icecrown Citadel when the time to strike upon us.
sentences.chinese: 我将会在时机降临时加入攻打冰冠城塞的最后一战。

sentences.english: Let bad luck come down on both the houses.
sentences.chinese: 让坏运降临到这两个家庭吧。

sentences.english: To prepare for the coming storm, the first task of the newly-formed alliance was to fortify their defenses.
sentences.chinese: 为应对灾难降临，新联盟的首要任务就是巩固防御。

sentences.english: Then, as the warm winds chase away snow and ice, new life begins.
sentences.chinese: 然后，当暖风吹破冰雪，新生降临。

sentences.english: The kind of fame that hounded Pollock's life and death never quite came to Still.
sentences.chinese: 围绕波洛克生与死的那种名望从未降临到史蒂尔身上。

sentences.english: He began to imagine all kinds of frightening things that could happen to him.
sentences.chinese: 他开始想像各种可能降临到他头上的可怕的事情。

sentences.english: As night fell, work went on by oil lamp and candlelight.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临时，僧侣们点起油灯和蜡烛，继续干活。

sentences.english: And meet joy in these dew-falling hours.
sentences.chinese: 会在这露水降临之时遇欢乐。

sentences.english: Knowing the Pentecostals has enriched and changed my life.
sentences.chinese: 认识圣灵降临节的信徒们丰富并且改变了我的生活。

sentences.english: Come, Thou Dayspring, come and cheer our spirits by Thine advent here.
sentences.chinese: 来吧，你这清晨的日光，以你的降临鼓舞我们的心灵。

sentences.english: Some misfortune must have befallen him.
sentences.chinese: 某种灾难必降临在他头上了。

definition: lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to be born/arrival of newborn/birth (of a savior or religious leader)
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to invade/(of a storm etc) to strike/to hit
to come to/to awaken/to regain consciousness
to be born/to come into being/to withdraw from worldly affairs
